page.title: 18Boating in Dale
page.content: Boating is a very popular leisure activity.Of the 90 or so occupied houses in the area,26 own 1 or more boats.Many more boats are owned by visitors.There is no harbour,but about 150 boats are kept on sheltered moorings to the N.W. of Dale Point. About 50 dinghies are kept at the top of the beach.Others are brought down for short periods on trailers or car roofs.Many of these boats are used for sailing;the larger ones,up to 40' long for cruising and racing;the smaller ones for day sailing in Milford Haven and racing organised by Dale Yacht Club.Other boats are used for fishing or general enjoyment and exploration. These are mostly boats with inboard or outboard engines.Some boats are used by divers,who go out to wrecks or other interesting underwater locations.
